alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 3:09PM EDT until July 04 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Middlesex, Morris, and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Morristown, Somerville, Carteret, Madison, Middlesex, Florham Park, East Hanover, Bound Brook, Manville, Chatham, Boonton, and Rockaway. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 13. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 38 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 4 and 9...and between mile markers 12 and 15...and between mile markers 27 and 44. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 131 and 134. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
